channel.title: Please help...i need help with my clients compiler...thanks in advance!
channel.description:
first...i have galkons client that i downloaded. i also was trying to use some of the custom items and needed to compile it...so i thought " hey....ill just use the compiler that came with it..." Aww Heck no.....its not that easy...some reason, it wont compile...here is my code
@echo off title Compiler if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit
after i used the code it came in... and unsucessfully compiling the CLIENT i came up with an error... here is the error
you do not have Java installed...
and it also says:
'about' is not an internal or external command...or something like that
thanks for all the help in advance! please email your responce to cjkale5@yahoo.com! or you can respond to the forums...( i prefer email b/c i check it more often...thanks)

item.title: Please help...i need help with my clients compiler...thanks in advance!
item.dc:creator: @jake_cake jake cake
item.description:
@jake_cake wrote:

I had the same problem with that client… I just got a new compiler code… Try this one it works great

@echo off COLOR 0a title YOURSERVERNAME Compiler echo ------------------------- echo Files Being Compiled... echo ------------------------- "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause

Change this:

C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin\javac.exe

To your JDK version and where it is located… most peoples jdk is located in program files but mine is located in program files (x86) change the _20 to your version eg. if you got jdk 17 you would change the 20 to a 17… Hope this helps!

Read full topic
item.source: Please help...i need help with my clients compiler...thanks in advance!

item.title: Please help...i need help with my clients compiler...thanks in advance!
item.dc:creator: @creed911 creed911
item.description:
@creed911 wrote:

first…i have galkons client that i downloaded. i also was trying to use some of the custom items and needed to compile it…so i thought " hey…ill just use the compiler that came with it…" Aww Heck no…its not that easy…some reason, it wont compile…here is my code

@echo off
title Compiler
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

after i used the code it came in… and unsucessfully compiling the CLIENT i came up with an error… here is the error

you do not have Java installed…

and it also says:

‘about’ is not an internal or external command…or something like that

thanks for all the help in advance! please email your responce to cjkale5@yahoo.com! or you can respond to the forums…( i prefer email b/c i check it more often…thanks)

Read full topic
item.source: Please help...i need help with my clients compiler...thanks in advance!
